speaker: Roz
text: I'm sorry I brought Alice today when we have so much work to do.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, that's all right, Roz.  You know what, you'll find another nanny soon.

speaker: Roz
text: I better.  I have a date tomorrow.  It's my first one in a month.  A month!  Between spending my days with you and my nights with Alice, I've forgot what a real conversation is like.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, don't tell Alice that, it might hurt her feelings.

speaker: Roz
text: There we go again! _Roz enters as Martin and Niles enter.  Niles is in his suit, Martin is wearing a long overcoat.  They all greet each other._

speaker: Niles
text: Just look at the dapper gent I ran into on the elevator.

speaker: Martin
text: All right, Niles, that's enough.  Yes, I like the suit you got me. [_Martin takes overcoat off revealing a black suit_]

speaker: Niles
text: All right.  Well, tell me about the comments.  Did everybody there ooh and aah?

speaker: Martin
text: Nope, people were pretty much looking at the guy in the casket.

speaker: Frasier
text: So, Dad, how was the funeral?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, it was terrible.  It's not at all the way Stan would have wanted it.  They did everything on the cheap and that daughter of his, she didn't even get the good priest.  She got some rookie from the seminary who stumbled all through the eulogy and couldn't even pronounce "Wojadubakowski!"

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I can commiserate with you, Dad.  I had a rather bad day on the death front myself. [_heads to sherry shelf_] Sherry?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes please, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: [_pours two glasses_] I received a letter today saying, thanks to my divorce, I've lost my plot at Seattle's toniest cemetery.

speaker: Frasier
text: You mean, you're out of "Verdant Hills?"  Oh, I am sorry, I know how much you were looking forward to being dead there.

speaker: Niles
text: They've wait-listed me, but I don't like my odds.

speaker: Frasier
text: I don't blame you.  One country club fire, you can kiss your chances goodbye.

speaker: Daphne
text: I went to all sorts of funerals as a child.  My uncle's a mortician.  Lovely man.  He's offered to do my make-up for the wedding. [_exits to her room_]

speaker: Frasier
text: I can just hear the whispers now.  "Did you see the bride? Very life-like."  Dad, you know, I'm sorry about your friend's funeral not going so well.  Rest assured, when the time comes - years from now - Niles and I will follow your wishes to the letter.

speaker: Martin
text: Thank you.

speaker: Niles
text: Wait, Dad, what are your wishes?

speaker: Martin
text: Never mind, I'm not going to go planning my own funeral, it's bad luck.

speaker: Frasier
text: But, Dad...

speaker: Martin
text: Ah, ah, ah, you don't pull the cord on the bus until you're ready to get off.

speaker: Niles
text: [_confused_] Pull the what on the what?

speaker: Frasier
text: I don't know.

speaker: Niles
text: I'm surprised.  I didn't know Dad had such a bugaboo about his funeral arrangements.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yeah, I know, it's a painful subject, but we've got to plan for it.  We all must be prepared when the cold hand of death comes knocking on our door. _A knocking is then heard on the front door.  Frasier and Niles look at each other._

speaker: Frasier
text: Would you get that?

speaker: Niles
text: I most certainly will not. _Frasier stands and opens the door.  It's the pizza delivery guy, who is none other than Bob "Bulldog" Briscoe.  He thrusts the pizza into Frasier's hand._

speaker: Bulldog
text: Pizza.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_taking it_] Oh, thank you very much. [_notices_] Bulldog? Good Lord, come in. [_he does_] Oh heavens, you remember my brother Niles.  Niles, you remember Bulldog.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, of course.  Hello, Bulldog.  So, are you delivering pizzas for a living?

speaker: Bulldog
text: [_sarcastic_] No, I'm an eccentric millionaire, this has always been my dream.

speaker: Frasier
text: Bulldog, I can't tell you...

speaker: Bulldog
text: [_interrupts_] No, no, no.  Can the sad face, okay?  Just making some extra cash between radio gigs.

speaker: Frasier
text: All right.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Oh, it's eighteen bucks, by the way.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I just stopped by to leave off these opera tickets. [_hands them to Frasier_] So, I'll be on my way.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you, Niles.  By the way, I'm a little short of cash. Do you mind, er-?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh yes, thank you. [_hands Bulldog some money_] There you are, and something extra for you. [_hands Bulldog a twenty dollar bill_]

speaker: Bulldog
text: Whoa, that's a pretty generous tip!

speaker: Niles
text: I'll say, wrong bill! [_exchanges it for a one dollar bill_]

speaker: Bulldog
text: Hey, good luck, Doc, I'll see you.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_shakes his hand_] Thanks Bulldog, take care.

speaker: Bulldog
text: All right. _Bulldog crosses to the door but is stopped when Roz appears back from the bedrooms._

speaker: Roz
text: Bulldog?

speaker: Bulldog
text: Hello, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: Are you delivering pizzas?

speaker: Bulldog
text: Yeah, yeah, this is kinda awkward, huh?

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, no, don't be embarrassed.  A job's a job.

speaker: Bulldog
text: No, I mean awkward for you.  This is the first time you've seen me since we had that fling and I dumped ya.

speaker: Roz
text: I dumped you, pizza boy!

speaker: Bulldog
text: Hey, look who's here!  Hey, sweet pea, you are getting so big. Hey, look at that smile, she likes me.

speaker: Roz
text: She's relieved not to be the least mature person in the room anymore.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Who's got a mean old mommy? _Bulldog goes to play with Alice as Frasier calls Roz over to talk to him._

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz.  Listen, I think you may have solved your babysitting problem.

speaker: Roz
text: Bulldog?  Are you nuts?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, look: Alice is obviously crazy about him, and he could use the money.

speaker: Roz
text: I don't know.

speaker: Frasier
text: Okay, fine, fine, Roz. You just cancel your date.  I mean, you've been this long without a man, what's a few days more?

speaker: Roz
text: Bulldog, do you want a job? **THE NANNY**  _Scene Two - Roz's Apartment. Bulldog and Alice are at the dinner table.  He is feeding her._

speaker: Bulldog
text: Okay, one more bite, then we can watch "Sports Center."

speaker: Roz
text: Have you seen my purse?

speaker: Bulldog
text: Yeah, it's on the chair.

speaker: Roz
text: [_picks it up_] Steve's going to be here any minute.

speaker: Bulldog
text: So, you've been dating for a while?

speaker: Roz
text: Actually, no.  Tonight's our first date.  In fact, it's my first date in a month.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Whoa!  You injured?  You pull something?

speaker: Roz
text: No.

speaker: Bulldog
text: I guess no one quite measured up to that week you spent in the doghouse, huh?

speaker: Roz
text: Let's get one thing straight.  That little fling we had...

speaker: Bulldog
text: I know, I know, I was just joking.

speaker: Bulldog
text: [_to Alice_] Okay.  If you're not going to have some peaches, we've got some jello in the fridge.  You know, some naughty ladies like to wrestle in that stuff.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Who's that?  Who's that? [_opens door to Steve_] He-ho.

speaker: Steve
text: Excuse me, is this Roz Doyle's apartment?

speaker: Bulldog
text: Yeah, yeah, are you her date?

speaker: Steve
text: Yeah. _Bulldog checks behind him for Roz, then grabs Steve by the front of his shirt._

speaker: Bulldog
text: Listen up: if you go out with Roz tonight, I will rip off your arm, ram it down your throat and use it to squeeze your heart until it stops beating. [_then to Alice_] Who's my pretty girl? [_grabs Steve_] Okay, dirtball.  Listen, when you get out of here, you call Roz and you cancel like a gentleman.  As far as she's concerned, this conversation never took place.  Got it?

speaker: Steve
text: Who are you?

speaker: Bulldog
text: I'm your worse nightmare: the babysitter! _Bulldog shuts the door on him as Roz enters.  She is wearing a very low-cut top._

speaker: Bulldog
text: Whoa!

speaker: Roz
text: Do I look slutty?

speaker: Bulldog
text: All right, if you're fishing for compliments: yeah, you look slutty.

speaker: Roz
text: Hello?  Hey, Steven.  Oh, really?  Well, tomorrow's Saturday, I mean you won't have to... No, it's okay.  Yeah, bye. [_hangs up_] I don't believe it!  My first date in a month and he blows me off.

speaker: Bulldog
text: What, at the last minute?  What a jerk!  He does not deserve you.

speaker: Roz
text: Thanks, Bulldog.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Well, I guess I can go.

speaker: Roz
text: Mmm.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Oh, I ordered a pizza.  Just have him drop it by my place. I'm at the YMCA.  Have him knock hard, I turn up the radio to drown out the sirens.

speaker: Roz
text: Why don't you just stay and have your pizza?

speaker: Bulldog
text: Are you sure?

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah, it's not like I'm doing anything tonight.  Come and tell us what you guys did at the park today.

speaker: Bulldog
text: We fed the ducks!  We went on a pony ride and then came back for a whole jar of peas.

speaker: Roz
text: Peas?  How did you get her to eat those?

speaker: Bulldog
text: There's a trick to it.  You've got to pretend to sneeze them out of your nose.

speaker: Roz
text: How did you come up with that?

speaker: Bulldog
text: It's an interesting story...

speaker: Roz
text: Actually, don't tell me. **THE PLOTS THICKEN**  _Scene Three - Caf e Nervosa. Frasier is sat drinking his coffee as Niles enters, pleased with himself. _

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, good afternoon, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Coffee's on me, I'm back at "Verdant Hills" cemetery.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, well congratulations, nothing left now but all that pesky waiting.

speaker: Niles
text: I haven't got the official word yet but I've called in a favor: Bruce McGurk, he's on the board of directors.  I gave him grief counseling when his uncle was lost at sea and it occurred to me, there's a plot gone begging!

speaker: Roz
text: Tell me something, do I have the word "loser" tattooed across my forehead?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, Roz, but there is a rumor about a "Tweety Bird" on your upper thigh.

speaker: Roz
text: I've had two dates this week and both of them have bailed out on me at the last second.  What's wrong with me?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, don't count yourself out just yet, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah, right.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, there's a young man over there, can't take his eyes off you.  He's been staring at you ever since you came in. _Roz looks at the man who is sitting by the window using his laptop. She gasps with recognition._

speaker: Roz
text: [_like a school girl_] That's Ted from the ad department! We've been making eye contact for months.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, yes, Ted.  Well, his gaze is so steamy it's re-foaming my latte.  Why don't you go other there and talk with him?

speaker: Roz
text: I can't.  I won't know what to say.

speaker: Frasier
text: I tell you what, ask him to dinner.  I'm going to "Chez Henri" myself this evening, I'll call and get you a table.

speaker: Roz
text: I don't know, I'm feeling a little gun shy.

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, you better hurry.  If you talk to me another minute longer, he'll think he's got some serious competition.

speaker: Roz
text: [_laughs_] Thanks, Frasier, I needed a good laugh to loosen me up. _Roz, laughing, goes over to chat with Ted.  Frasier then opens his cell phone and dials._

speaker: Frasier
text: [_into phone_] Hello, it's Frasier Crane. _Niles's cell phone starts ringing.  He answers it and sits with Frasier._

speaker: Frasier
text: I was just wondering, I'd like to get a table for a dear friend of mine tonight as well.

speaker: Niles
text: Niles Crane here.  Hello, Bruce.  I'm hoping you're calling with good news about "Verdant Hills?"

speaker: Frasier
text: Table for two.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, a plot for one.

speaker: Frasier
text: By the kitchen?  Oh Lord, I was hoping for something near the fireplace.

speaker: Niles
text: Near the parking lot?  I prefer the serenity garden.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, the back row would be fine, who's at the next table?

speaker: Niles
text: The hilltops?  Divine!  Who's in the adjacent plot?

speaker: Frasier
text: The Ashbys, wonderful!

speaker: Niles
text: The Ashbys, delightful!

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you very much.

speaker: Niles
text: I'm very grateful.

speaker: Niles
text: McGurk got me a shady spot on the high hill.

speaker: Frasier
text: You mean...?

speaker: Niles
text: [_ecstatic_] Yes, I'll spend eternity looking down on Maris.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Checkmate!

speaker: Roz
text: He said yes.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, of course he did Roz, congratulations.  And you're all set at "Chez Henri."

speaker: Roz
text: Great.

speaker: Bulldog
text: [_irate_] Okay, what sorry bastard would steal a pacifier from a kid? [_slams a table_] THIS STINKS!  THIS IS TOTAL B.S.! [_then_] Oh, found it, found it. [_gives it to Alice_]

speaker: Bulldog
text: Hi.

speaker: Roz
text: You know, Bulldog, I hate to do this to you.  Could you babysit tonight?  I just get a date with Ted over there.

speaker: Bulldog
text: [_miffed_] Really?  Sure, just say.  Way to go, slugger!

speaker: Roz
text: I better go home and get ready.

speaker: Bulldog
text: You go ahead, I'll catch up with you after I go to the can.

speaker: Roz
text: Lovely!

speaker: Bulldog
text: Hey, Ted, right?

speaker: Ted
text: Bulldog, long time, no see.

speaker: Bulldog
text: I heard you're going out with Roz tonight.

speaker: Ted
text: Yeah.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Listen up!  You have her home forty-five minutes after you pick her up or you'll be sorry.

speaker: Ted
text: Yeah? [_stands_] What are you going to do about it? _Bulldog holds his hand in front of Ted's face and breaks his own middle finger._

speaker: Ted
text: Oh my God!

speaker: Bulldog
text: If I'm willing to do that to me, just think what I'll do to you.

speaker: Ted
text: All right, forty-five minutes.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Or else! _Bulldog walks to the toilet feeling the pain as he goes.  Then Martin enters and crosses to the boys' table._

speaker: Martin
text: Hey boys, feel like taking a ride?

speaker: Frasier
text: Sure, Dad.  Where to?

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I got thinking about what we were talking about the other night, you know, about me not having made any arrangements for myself.  So, just went out and bought myself a burial plot.

speaker: Frasier
text: Okay, all right, let's go have a look, Dad.  I'm glad to see you've finally realized there's no point in being superstitious about the whole thing.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, well, I realized that if I let you plan my funeral there'd be all harps, white wine, and frankly a lot of very pissed-off cops! _Martin and the boys exit.  FADE TO:  Scene Four - Cemetery. Daphne is driving her red convertible around the cemetery.  Martin is giving her directions as Niles and Frasier listen in the back seat._

speaker: Martin
text: Right up here on the left.  I've got the whole service mapped out.  It'll start with a bagpiper marching down the aisle...

speaker: Daphne
text: Bagpipes?  I'm having bagpipes at my wedding, you knew that!

speaker: Martin
text: And none of that dainty finger food, either.  Big slabs of beef!  Prime rib.

speaker: Daphne
text: You can't have prime rib, I'm having prime rib.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, for Pete's sake.

speaker: Daphne
text: No, no, this is lovely!  If you kick off before I get married, you'll ruin everything.

speaker: Martin
text: All right, all right, I'll drop the bagpipes.

speaker: Daphne
text: No, no, have the bagpipes!  And what else are you going to have?  A big cake with a little white coffin on the top.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, put a sock in it, will ya?

speaker: Daphne
text: It wouldn't surprise me if you had a hearst with "Just Buried" on the side of it.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, stop it!  I'm warning you. _Daphne stops the car.  They get out.  Niles and Frasier are not impressed but put on a brave face.  They go to Martin's plot where a big building is situated behind._

speaker: Martin
text: Pretty great, huh?

speaker: Martin
text: I'll put your mom's ashes over there on the left.  Because that was her side of the bed and, er, oh, see how close we are to the maintenance shed. [_points out the building_]

speaker: Niles
text: And that's good because?

speaker: Martin
text: You're the first one to get mowed!  Yeah, so do you really like this place?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, Dad.

speaker: Martin
text: Good.  Fras', take about three steps over to your left, will ya?

speaker: Martin
text: There you are.  Niles, stand right next to him. [_Niles does_] Congratulations, you are standing on your very own graves.

speaker: Niles
text: What?!

speaker: Martin
text: Yes, they were for sale so I went ahead and bought them.  And seeing how much you like it out here, I'm glad I did.

speaker: Niles
text: But, Dad...

speaker: Martin
text: I know what you're gonna say, the expense!  But don't worry about it.  Merry Christmas! _Niles and Frasier looks horrified as Daphne holds in her laughter.  End of Act One.  Act Two.  Scene One - Roz's Apartment. Bulldog is preparing the dinner table for an evening meal.  The door opens and Bulldog runs off into the kitchen.  Ted and Roz enter._

speaker: Ted
text: Sorry we had to rush out like that.

speaker: Roz
text: Me too, is your stomach feeling any better?

speaker: Ted
text: [_looking around for signs of Bulldog_] Not really.

speaker: Roz
text: Fancy some ginger ale or...

speaker: Ted
text: I think I really better go now. _Ted runs out.  Roz closes the door and looks depressed and angry with herself.  She looks at her clothes and collapses on the couch.  Bulldog enters and acts surprised._

speaker: Bulldog
text: She's asleep Roz, don't worry I won't disturb you a... [_then_] Where's Ted?

speaker: Roz
text: He ditched me.

speaker: Bulldog
text: What?

speaker: Roz
text: He kept saying his stomach was bothering him, he was looking at his watch the whole time.

speaker: Bulldog
text: What is wrong with men?

speaker: Roz
text: It's not them, it's me.  It's been happening all week.

speaker: Bulldog
text: No, no, no, trust me.  It is not you.  They're just jerks.

speaker: Roz
text: Thanks, Bulldog.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Hey, look, if you're hungry, I just whipped up a little something.  There's probably enough for two.

speaker: Roz
text: Great.  I'm just gonna go change, okay?

speaker: Bulldog
text: Okay. _Roz exits to the bedrooms.  Bulldog gets to work.  With his feet he opens a cupboard as he lays the table.  He takes glasses already filled with wine out of it and a big pot of cooked pasta which he places on the table whilst shutting the cupboard with his foot. Then there's a knock at the door before Ted enters with Roz's purse._

speaker: Bulldog
text: What the hell are you doing here?

speaker: Ted
text: I know, I'm sorry.

speaker: Bulldog
text: You are supposed to be gone.  How many of my own fingers do I have to dislocate before you take me seriously?

speaker: Ted
text: I got her home in forty-five minutes, okay?  She left this in the car. _We see Roz is watching this scene from the hallway.  As Bulldog growls at him and shuts the door on him, she hides back in the bedroom.  She then reappears and puts a plan into action._

speaker: Roz
text: [_sits_] Oh, this smells delicious.  Thank you.  Ow, I guess I'm a little tense from that date.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Allow me. _Bulldog starts to massages her with his hand but feels the pain of his finger so instead he uses his elbow._

speaker: Roz
text: I forgot how good you were at this!  Come to think of it, you were good at a lot of things. _Roz sits back and sexily unbuttons her blouse revealing her underwear to him._

speaker: Bulldog
text: Wow!  "Victoria's Secrets," page 39.

speaker: Roz
text: Why don't we just skip dinner and go straight to dessert?

speaker: Bulldog
text: Uh-ho!  "Penthouse Forum," page 23. _Bulldog chases Roz to the bedroom.  Scene Two - Roz's Bedroom. Roz runs in and lays on the bed.  Bulldog strips in front of her._

speaker: Roz
text: [_saucy_] Are you the new pizza man?  I hope you're not double parked.

speaker: Bulldog
text: I promise you, ma'am.  I will deliver in thirty minutes or more.

speaker: Roz
text: There's a scented candle out on the balcony, would you get that for me?

speaker: Bulldog
text: I'm kinda naked here.

speaker: Roz
text: Cedar wood, it promotes stamina and sexual creativity.

speaker: Bulldog
text: I'll be right back. _Bulldog runs out onto the balcony and finds no candle.  Roz locks the balcony door on him._

speaker: Bulldog
text: Roz, open the door.  Oh, I get it. [_knocks_] Pizza man!

speaker: Roz
text: You slime bag!  You've been scaring off my dates all week.

speaker: Bulldog
text: I don't know what you're talking about.

speaker: Roz
text: Cut the crap.  I just saw you talking to Ted.  This is the lowest thing you've ever done!  After the way I've trusted you, this is the way I treat you.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Would you let me in, please?

speaker: Roz
text: No.

speaker: Bulldog
text: It's freezing out here, [_looks down_] as you can plainly see!

speaker: Roz
text: Good, I want you to suffer.

speaker: Roz
text: Don't sit there, I eat off that table, for God's sake!

speaker: Roz
text: Get dressed.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Come on, wait. _Roz runs out of the bedroom, Bulldog follows her.  Scene Three - Roz's Apartment. They enter the main room._

speaker: Bulldog
text: Wait, would you let me explain?

speaker: Roz
text: I don't want to hear it, you make me sick!  Just get it out.

speaker: Bulldog
text: I wasn't just trying to get you in bed.  Just give me a second, please. [_deep breath_] Last spring, when we were together, it was great and I didn't know how to handle it, so I ran away.  But when I saw you again, it was... I figured if I could keep the competition out of the way, then maybe you and I... I don't know... we could be a couple.

speaker: Roz
text: Us?

speaker: Bulldog
text: [_sincere_] I think I'm in love with you. _Roz is silent and doesn't know what to say.  She obviously cannot reciprocate._

speaker: Bulldog
text: [_crushed_] You're not saying anything, are you?

speaker: Roz
text: Wait a minute!  I know what you're doing!

speaker: Bulldog
text: What?

speaker: Roz
text: All this love stuff, it's just another way of getting me into bed.

speaker: Bulldog
text: No, Roz, no.

speaker: Roz
text: God, the oldest trick in the book!

speaker: Bulldog
text: Wait a minute, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: And you're still at it!  You're still at it!  You're not Bulldog!

speaker: Bulldog
text: No, listen. _Roz then shows to him that she knows he truly loves her but that she cannot love him back._

speaker: Roz
text: Give up, Bulldog.

speaker: Bulldog
text: [_feigned_] You can't blame a guy for trying!  I had you going, huh?  All the dishes and the watering.

speaker: Roz
text: You're the master.

speaker: Bulldog
text: Yeah, I even put childproof latches on the cabinet.  Part of my plan to get you in the sack.

speaker: Roz
text: You are such a pig!

speaker: Bulldog
text: Well, I better be going.

speaker: Roz
text: Okay.  Thank you for all of your help with Alice. [_opens door_] I'll see you, Bob.

speaker: Bulldog
text: I'll see you, Roz. _Bulldog then exits.  Roz is obviously frustrated and confused.  She goes to sip some wine as someone knocks at the door._

speaker: Roz
text: [_shouts_] I'm sorry, Mrs. Wasnick, I know the balcony is not for sex play!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_off stage_] It's Frasier.  And by the way, charming!

speaker: Roz
text: It's open!

speaker: Frasier
text: I just saw you dash out of the restaurant with Ted, I thought, "God, what's wrong?"

speaker: Roz
text: You are not gonna believe what just happened.  Bulldog just told me he loved me.

speaker: Frasier
text: What?

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah, he made Ted bring me home early, turns out he's been scaring my dates off all week.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, what did you say to him?

speaker: Roz
text: I tried to let him down easy, I felt sorry for the guy.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_amazed_] Bulldog, wow, he's full of surprises, isn't he?

speaker: Roz
text: Who'd have thought?  You know what's really weird?  I'm gonna miss him. [_points to dinner_] Look at this.  I never had to worry about Alice, he kept this place so neat and it was really nice to have someone to... [_reflects_] someone to come home to.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, maybe Bulldog, in his own clumsy way, gave you a taste of a more traditional lifestyle.

speaker: Roz
text: Yes, I suppose so.

speaker: Frasier
text: Who knows, Roz?  Maybe the time has come.  You might be willing to start looking for a...

speaker: Roz
text: [_against the idea_] What?  A husband?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, I wasn't going to say that.

speaker: Roz
text: Just because I'm gonna miss certain things about Bulldog doesn't mean I need to rush out and get married.  Look at this week I've had.  Three guys interested in me and not to mention Bulldog.  I'm liking this! [_reassuring herself, arguably in denial_] Single life is pretty good.

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, Roz, as long as you're okay.

speaker: Roz
text: I really appreciate you coming by.

speaker: Frasier
text: It's okay.

speaker: Roz
text: I'll see you tomorrow.

speaker: Frasier
text: Of course.  Good night.

speaker: Roz
text: Good night. _Frasier exits and Roz closes the door.  Roz takes a deep breath and heads over to the dinner table.  She takes Bulldog's glass of wine and pours its content into hers, making a big glassful.  She draws up a seat and pulls over the pasta pot.  She tucks in with a thoughtful expression on her face.  End of Act Two._
